caption: There are so many beautiful churches in Paris. This almost impossible to fathom. I've already reviewed quite a few here, hidden gems . This is another one but it's impossible to visit them all. So you'll just have to walk around and visit them as they come your way, like this one, right after having visitied the Louvre.
This is a magnificent Church that is tucked away, one street back from the river, and can be easily overlooked as tourist pass by on their way to Louvre. The bell tower stands proud in the skyline.

We accidentally stumbled upon this incredible church in Sept, so when I found myself back in Paris in Jan with my boys, I had to bring them here.  This is 1 of the most beautiful churches I've ever been into & I make it a point to go into every church I possibly can, wherever I visit.  It's right next to The Louvre, so if you find yourself in that area (& who doesn't when visiting Paris), then I absolutely recommend this gem.   It's truly spectacular & well worth the time.  In fact, every time I visit Paris, I will definitely visit here.  It's free to visit & you can purchase candles to light inside via cash, apple pay or Google wallet.  Even if you aren't spiritual,  there's something about being in these beautiful,  historical places that is just magical.
A beautiful Catholic Church just around the corner from the Louvre Museum.
One of many churches in Paris.Old architecture and design is beautiful.
In addition to the extraordinary art and significance of this church, the energy and peace of this historical landmark is what I loved the most. I can’t wait to come back for prayer and meditation.

A beautiful church just behind the louvre If you are in the area pass by It’s a hidden gem and in my opinion I would rank it at the same level of Notre Dame or even higher in terms of history details You can see on the wall engravings from 1216 Once you are inside you get this amazing feeling of peacefulness and holiness  I was lucky to be able to attend a service

Beautiful and historical structure. The art of curves and carvings is worth visiting. Despite facing state of the art Louvre Museum in Paris... this Catheredal church has its own grace and whoever pass by this for the first time. Must take a photo.

Beautiful church next to the Louvre with free entry. The inside is absolutely stunning rich in history. The statues, the stained glass and the altar were very beautiful and worth the visit. Recommend visiting if you have time.
A lovely church, many beautiful vitrage windows. Worth a visit, very close to other attractions, just  step in. A world of peace and beauty.

Situated opposite the Louvre Museum, the church is of Merovingian origin.  Beautiful church inside and out.  The first church of Saint-Germain-l'Auxerrois was destroyed in 885-886, then rebuilt in the 11th century.  Changes were made to the building in the first half of the 12th century and the western portal was built around 1220-1230.  The choir and the first bay of the chapel of the Virgin date from the 14th century, the nave and the present porch from the following century, the transept and the choir chapels from the 16th century.  The church is in particular associated with the tragic episode of St. Bartholomew's Day.

The Church of Saint-Germain-l'Auxerrois is a 15th-century church located at Place du Louvre just east of the museum on the Right Bank. This is an attractive building with Romanesque, Gothic and Renaissance features that is worth viewing if you enjoy seeing historic churches during your travels.  The history of the church dates back to the 7th century however, it was reconstructed several times over the centuries. The present church contains 13th-century sections while its bulk seems to come from the 15th-century.  What you will see is a delightful exterior, an impressively decorated porch with carved pillars and large rose windows, the works of Jean Gaussel. There is a medieval tower in front of the church that is nice to view as well.  Within Eglise St-Germain l'Auxerrois you will find a traditional narrow nave with high vaulted ceiling and pulpit. There are beautiful stained-glass windows as well as an impressive altarpieces of stone and wooden sculptures. Do spend a couple minutes in the side chapel near the back of the church where you are treated to beautiful frescos behind the altar.  In the end, this is a really nice church, one that we much enjoyed viewing during our recent stay in Pais. Will definitely make time to revisit during future trips to the city.
This church is just a short walk from the Metro and the  Louvre. The outside facade & the interior are very grand. It's worth the visit & very typical of French Cathedrals. Highly recommended

Another delightful "hidden" church in Paris, for peaceful prayers and silent thoughts. It is quite a big one with many impressive frames to watch and large corridors. Most are still in good condition and related to lot of History too. Also, lot of seats for people to pray and some candles to offer (1 or 2€ each). Very pleasant place to stop, even for a quick visit, since the church is open most of the day.
Gorgeous church with ornate stained glass windows impressive architecture and beautiful flower gardens outside. It’s free entry and a peaceful place to sit and connect.

Great cathedral doesn't get enough word of mouth it is very old and charming and close to the louvre, try to pop in before or after as there are several statues and chapels that are intriguing.  The entrance was special as well

The name of the church of Saint-Germain l’Auxerrois is given in honor of Bishop Germanus of Auxerre.The history of the church dates back to the 7th century, but the current building can be dated to the 15th century. Like many churches in Paris over the centuries, it has been remodeled several times and given Romanesque, Gothic and Renaissance styles. Saint-Germain l’Auxerrois played an important role during the religious wars. "Night of Bartholomew" - On August 24, 1572, at 2 o'clock in the morning, church bells rang, signaling the Mass extermination of the Huguenots by Catholics. Because of this, the term "Bartholomew's Night" is associated with a symbol of mass violence. This fact was described by the  French writer Alexandre Dumas in his famous novel - "Queen Margo"
A forgotten place among travelers. It's a must visit place. Such a unique architecture. Historical place. The calmness u feel when you are inside is undesirable.
Beautiful and robust looking cathedral with gothic style elements and architecture.
Amazing church located near the Louvre museum. Worth a visit!
Probably one of the best gothic style churches in the Paris center. Must visit. The statues are stunning.
Paris is choc-full of *great* churches. Here's another with more great windows: Saint-Germain-l'Auxerrois.

I never entered this church, but came upon it during my first walk in the city. The sight of the tower took my breath away. Simply stunning. I would love to tour this historic site, one of Paris's oldest churches.
What a very beautiful church! We were lucky enough to hear the organist playing while we were there
Accidently found out. But beautiful inside
paris is one of the most beautiful cities on the world…walk and enjoy the views…

A pillar of gorgeous architecture. The stained glass art work is beautiful, the colors are so deep and vivid and are a spectacle to see. I would recommend all to come and visit and enjoy the artwork. All this said, we must remember that Christ is Lord and King, the depictions of Mary and Saints are misleading. They are all subjects to our Lord and we must remember that all glory goes to God in heaven. There is but one mediator between God and Man and that is our Lord Jesus of Nazareth the Christ. God Bless all.
Lovely Catholic church next to Louvre that can easily be missed and should be visited.
One of the best gothic style church in Paris
smaller church with nice stained glass, towers, and arches... usually not crowded.
It is not an overwhelmingly large church. So, within minutes of your arrival you can get a good feel and appreciation of what it has to offer.
Absolutely fantastic architecture. Interior feels like heaven vestibule.  So graceful, so beautiful, so sophisticated. Sublime pur.
The outside is stunning, couldn’t enter because of the Olympic Games though.

We came across this church on the way to the Louvre. Turns out it's located behind it. The tower was reminiscent of another tower that we passed on the way here (Tower of Saint Jacques). We didn't have time to go in but the church itself looked niced from the outside.

Beautiful functioning church just behind the Louvre. It has a statue of St Denis, the beheaded bishop of Paris in 250 who according to the legend walked holding his head in his arms. A good place to visit after visiting the museum and get another perspective of a very old church and place in Paris

This Roman Catholic Church is one of the many churches you'll find in Paris, it is closer to the Louvre Museum, the tower is impressive,  the church has stained glass and a rose window, there are wooden statues , and the Flemish altarpiece is just amazing. This one is worth visiting too. This place is next to the city hall of the district of Paris.

Since I have been here in Paris and visited this church for the first time last year,  I felt the presence and connection with God and how solemn they commence the mass. I always attend the mass every sunday and always feel bless when I go home.
This is a beautiful church. It is free to entry and the church is still active
